title: 10 thoughts going into Week 4 -- "Right now MikeYeung is like a Lee Sin player who just landed Sonic Wave and can‚Äôt decide if he should take the Resonating Strike."

replies.body:
We‚Äôre already two-thirds of the way through the season! Here‚Äôs this week‚Äôs 10 thoughts (or is this a Tide commercial?).

From the bottom of first paragraph. What? 2/3 through lol
fractions are hard :(
you obviously meant through winter, right? not the NA LCS spring split season, correct? just beginning february, there's still 1 month to go until spring, thus 2/3 through the season.

I don't tend to comment because I feel like I'm nitpicking, but...

"Just look at what happened to SKT without their star and savior, Huni."

I have no idea if this is meant to be a serious point or sarcasm. Peanut's gone, not that he was particularly effective last season. Wolf was the jungler for the first two weeks. They didn't pull Effort off support until they lost the first game to MVP in their fifth match. Even with Wolf back at support, apparently he's still mostly playing jungle in solo queue.

But "star and savior" is so off it sounds like you're poking fun at the struggles he had last season. I genuinely have no idea how to take this.
I'm poking fun at the people who blamed him for being the problem. I thought Huni played very well last year on SKT.

You are absolutely wrong. If you have watched their mic check, you will see Huni was "the problem" of SKT. I am not saying Huni is bad, but he is an aggressive top laner. (Same thing applies to peanut) SKT is a team that focus most of their resources on mid and bot (faker and bang). I rmb one of the mic check in world during the Ban phase, Huni confidently told KKoma he wants to pick GP, and he got focussed and smashed. At the backstage, Kkoma literally told Huni he didn't ask more from him, just stop pushing the lane and die, and he will find him a safe pick. They need a safe top laner, and supportive jungler. It was obvious peanut and Huni did not fit into SKT's play style, and that's why they kind of struggle last year.

This year SKT is struggled for a different reason. After their defeat at world, they've decided to find their old style back (mid lane focus), and thus they release peanut and Huni, and trying train the rookie into the 2nd Marin and bengi.

I agree i thought huni was the best performing member at worlds. He looked great and i feel SKT made a massive mistake by replacing him. I feel like skt had this mindset of if you don't win your first year as a new member your gone....
This guys memes are as clean as his writing. Great stuff my dude.

I find it funny how people keep mentioning TSM's wins outside of 100T are against the bottom end of the league. You do realize that all of TL's victories are over the bottom half of the league?? Outside of the TSM win (first game and all) the only other team in the top 5 they played was 100T... and they lost!

while thats true the big difference is how they won the games they did. for instance the same teams tsm beat it took 45-60 minutes to close games out they should have been able to smash. where tl is closing these games out in pre 30 minute fashion. so even though they are bottom tier teams they're crushing them not struggling to close out. also they kinda crushed tsm as well so there's that too....
Bring back the E-Sports page/board

Just wanted to hop in the conversation to say that I really like the questions at the end of the "Game of the Week" section.

Personally speaking, while both of these bot lanes are probably #1 and #2 in the league, I just don't see it as THE factor for TL vs C9. Top, JG and Mid....these seem to have more importance all around than what happens in the bottom side of the map. I think your point on Licorice and Impact is quite true, and I feel like it will be the breaking point for the game.

But, how much fun would it be if this became a fiesta in the bot lane.....anyways, can't wait for the game, and keep up the good work!

Lemonnation needs to get subbed out for the about four games. He's trash. Either that or become the first team in history to trade for him giving up some free breakfast, cause if you put Lemonation with Hai, who carried lemonnation and that team to the worlds. Hai is my favorite player, but he needs somone he can really trust on that squad and I think lemonnation although he is playing absolutely terrible a new change of scenery and a new team with a good friend could help him actually be somewhat avg again.
Logged just to Up Arrow. Put em with Hai.
Pretty sure the author meant "We‚Äôre already one-third of the way through the season!"...not two-thirds. I was very thrown off by that haha
No you're not Kien. It's not "FreeLG" it's "Constantly Losing Games" Keep at it.
Licorice & Smoothie, yummy!

I just hope games aren't these 20 mins stomps like the 2016 season was where if it wasn't for teams like Renegades, Origen, Echo Fox, and Unicorns of Love games would have really been near the 20 min stomps in average time.  "Oh, no games are 40-50-1hr long" 1. The meta is/was unclear at the time.  2. Riot said and set up themselves in their minds the better teams to face each other at the start of the split to create hype, with 2 good teams games will be drawn out some.  
  With the recent nerfs to such factors that resulted in 30% of the game lengths + calculating the mediocre scheduling now that it's week 4- I only see games being at the 33 min average now which is boring to me personally.  Nothing is more ignoring than to come home from work expecting to watch great games and to only watch 1 sided snoozes!   

A couple of games ago Xmithie passed the 2,000 assist marker and currently stands at 2,051 assists in which I think it's #1 NA/EU current All-Time assist leader for junglers!  His full stat-line is currently at 282(gms)  619(kills)  784(deaths)  2,051(assist) and 43,000(cs). So, congratulations to Xmithie!  

At the moment Doublelift is making a case for MVP in which would surprisingly be his first MVP in his career(I think).  Other MVP considerations are Sneaky, Smoothie, Pobelter, Fenix, Dardoch, and Jensen.  However, we all know Bjergsen will win MVP cause...... logic.

I never leave a comment on this, but the writing seems like phreak did this, also, it wasn't Michael Jordan that made Just do it popular, it was Nike...I'm seriously triggered by ignorant comments like that.
you write good articles, dude
The last sentence needs an edit: And will 'being'

"And will be the better bot lane be the difference in this matchup?"
Someone at Riot didn't do their editing job.
I think you meant 1/3rds of the way through the season ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Doublelift ?????? Lmao.  Compare with LPL and LCK ur trash.

Hate the fact that SKT is stated as losing because they lost Huni. It is more because of Faker whos not able to keep up the pressure since he doesnt have that supporting jungler who is always by his side. Bengi was very good at that. Everytime bengi will make a play, it would most likely be mid lane, around Faker. Also, if seen in picks, Faker is usually the one who gives up the pick and ban phase in order to help other lanes, thus sacrificing his own lane control.

but it could be stated that he's receiving all this pressure since his side lanes aren't creating any pressure against the opposing team either. if the side lanes don't generate pressure its easy for the enemy jungle to sit mid and camp skt's only strong point making the entire team fall apart. with huni in skt he generated so much pressure top that it allowed for options and points of contention for his jungle and the enemy jungle to have to contest and match or lose hard in another lane besides just mid.
